details: Departs A Coruña aboard the Pizarro under Spanish authorization.
Six-day stop; climbs Teide and records botanical and geological observations.
Unexpected landfall at Cumaná due to illness on board; begins Venezuelan studies.
Fieldwork in coastal Venezuela and Caracas; preparations for interior travel.
Confirms Casiquiare canal linking Orinoco and Amazon drainages; extensive river observations.
Returns from the interior; ships seeds and specimens to Europe.
Sails from Venezuela to Cuba to organize collections and survey Havana.
Surveys Havana and nearby towns; compiles statistics with Arango y Parreño.
Returns to mainland; ascends the Magdalena toward the Andes.
Meets José Celestino Mutis; studies the expedition’s botanical archive.
Surveys Ecuadorian volcanoes and highland ecology.
Historic high-altitude climb; reaches ~5,600 m with Bonpland and Montúfar.
Oceanographic, astronomical and economic observations around Lima.
Departs Ecuador by sea en route to New Spain.
Landfall at Acapulco; begins Mexican itinerary inland to Mexico City.
Royal College of Mines, astronomical/barometric surveys; visits mines and volcanoes.
Examines major silver operations and mining methods.
Embarks from Veracruz, routing via Cuba back toward Europe.
Collects plant material; completes island surveys and notes.
Short visit; meetings with Thomas Jefferson and American scientists.
Arrives in France and later settles in Paris to analyze results.

place_raw: Berlin → St. Petersburg (start of Russian expedition)
details: Sets out under Tsar Nicholas I’s patronage with Ehrenberg and Gustav Rose.
Geological and mining surveys across the Urals around Yekaterinburg.

place_raw: Altai border excursion (Ust-Kamenogorsk, Bukhtarma, Chinese border)
details: Excursion from Ust‑Kamenogorsk via Bukhtarma to the Chinese border and back.
Studies Caspian Sea levels and Aral–Caspian system during return leg.
Completes ~19,000 km circuit through the Russian Empire.
